When trying to experimentally translate a couple of tests to JUnit 4.4
asse=
rtThat syntax, I'm running into a problem:

How would you translate

assert=
False(myObject.equals(null)) 

so that "myObject.equals(null)" will be call=
ed on test execution.

assertThat(null, not(eq(myObject)))
and
assertThat(m=
yObject, not(eq(null)))

don't seem to execute "myObject.equals(null)" due =
to some hamcrest magic.

But maybe I'm just being dumb...

Johannes

PS: It=
's also strange (ie. unexpected behaviour) that 
assertThat(new Object(), n=
ot(eq(myObject))
does not compile but I have to add a cast to myObject.
